block.p: Pauline Valerie Golbin, a dancer in the New York City Ballet, and Stefan Victor Reyniak, a venture capitalist, were married yesterday at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Thomas More in Manhattan. The Rev. Alfredo Balinong performed the ceremony, at which Wynton Marsalis, a friend of the bride's, played the trumpet.

The bride, 26, will continue to use her name professionally. She joined the New York City Ballet in 1994 and is a senior corps member, recently touring with the company in Japan and Scotland. She was born in Caracas, Venezuela, grew up in Miami and studied at the School of American Ballet in New York. She is a daughter of Ximena and Bernard Golbin of Miami. Her father owns BG & Associates, a company in Miami and Caracas that designs and manufactures watersports clothing. Her mother is an interior decorator in Miami.

Pauline Valerie Golbin, a dancer in the New York City Ballet, and Stefan Victor Reyniak, a venture capitalist, were married yesterday at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Thomas More in Manhattan. The Rev. Alfredo Balinong performed the ceremony, at which Wynton Marsalis, a friend of the bride's, played the trumpet.

The bride, 26, will continue to use her name professionally. She joined the New York City Ballet in 1994 and is a senior corps member, recently touring with the company in Japan and Scotland. She was born in Caracas, Venezuela, grew up in Miami and studied at the School of American Ballet in New York. She is a daughter of Ximena and Bernard Golbin of Miami. Her father owns BG & Associates, a company in Miami and Caracas that designs and manufactures watersports clothing. Her mother is an interior decorator in Miami.

The bridegroom, 31, is a founding partner in Catamount Ventures, a venture capital company in San Francisco. He graduated from Columbia University and received law and M.B.A. degrees from Harvard. He is a son of Sibylle Reyniak and Dr. J. Victor Reyniak of New York. His father, a former president of the New York Gynecological Society, has a private practice in reproductive medicine and surgery in New York and is a clinical professor of obstetrics, gynecology and reproductive science at the Mount Sinai School of Medicine. Until 1998, the bridegroom's mother was a director of the Singers Development Foundation, a nonprofit organization that provides grants and career advice to opera singers.
